wiki.content: "We like to call this style of our music 'Cybermetal.' 'Zero' has six rhythm guitars, with two line-in 12-string acoustics, plus those wacky James Iha leads. Tracked live with overdubs added later, this is a true mover as well as the first song that was recorded for Mellon Collie And The Infinite Sadness, James has always said this reminds him of Judas Priest." -Billy Corgan (Guitar World 1/97) User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "We like to call this style of our music 'Cybermetal.' 'Zero' has six rhythm guitars, with two line-in 12-string acoustics, plus those wacky James Iha leads. Tracked live with overdubs added later, this is a true mover as well as the first song that was recorded for Mellon Collie And The Infinite Sadness, James has always said this reminds him of Judas Priest." -Billy Corgan (Guitar World 1/97)
